Description: Ostracon, large section of the body of a mottled red pottery vessel, with five lines of black-painted demotic text on the exterior. The text is a dedication to Thoth the Greatest of Five.
Curator's comments: The fabric is coarse and dark-grey in section, interior grooved, base rounded and sides flaring.
Bibliographic references: Peet 1914 / Cemeteries of Abydos II. 1911-1912 (124, pl.25.4)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393114) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393114)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.5)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 5 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
